s.text: Becker succeeds in establishing the famine "as one of the worst atrocities of all time" (Richard Bernstein, the New York Times ). He does this despite the Chinese government's continued effort to cover up the incident, and by way of "interviews with survivors [that] provide us with a chilling view of the famine as it was experienced by ordinary villagers" (Paul Pickowicz, the Wall Street Journal ).

Becker succeeds in establishing the famine "as one of the worst atrocities of all time" (Richard Bernstein, the New York Times ). He does this despite the Chinese government's continued effort to cover up the incident, and by way of "interviews with survivors [that] provide us with a chilling view of the famine as it was experienced by ordinary villagers" (Paul Pickowicz, the Wall Street Journal ).
Art --"Willem de Kooning: The Late Paintings, the 1980s";
In every other respect, however, critics find it numbingly familiar.

There is also "his power of formal arrangement and his sense of color" (Robert Hughes, Time).
Book -- A Supposedly Fun Thing I'll Never Do Again: Essays and Arguments , by David Foster Wallace;
Book -- Le Divorce , by Diane Johnson.
